posts.post_content:
T1, [Champion of the Parish](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Champion of the Parish). T2 [Gather The Townsfolk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gather The Townsfolk). T3, Crusader. T4, [Odric, Master Tactician](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Odric, Master Tactician).  
You now swing for 12 unblockable on turn 4 or you take out whatever you feel like, cast increasing devotion on t5 and swing for lethal.  
And this is a simple synergy in Standard

Posted By: LordBubbles (7/8/2012 6:54:23 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I think this usually works in green better. Green has easy access to trample and produces tokens \*slightly\* better; though I could be wrong with all the recent token love white has gotten. Green is also the color of giant fatties. Lure effects also favor green in this way.   
  
Still, arguments can be made due to white's ability to tap creatures down, protection from colors (meaning it can get through unblocked) etc. make it a decent fit. Still. I think I prefer the mechanic in green.
posts.html:
I think this usually works in green better. Green has easy access to trample and produces tokens *slightly* better; though I could be wrong with all the recent token love white has gotten. Green is also the color of giant fatties. Lure effects also favor green in this way.

Still, arguments can be made due to white's ability to tap creatures down, protection from colors (meaning it can get through unblocked) etc. make it a decent fit. Still. I think I prefer the mechanic in green.
